sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Will it be Emmanuel Macron or Marine Le Pen?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The two candidates go head to head in France's second round of the presidential election.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken visits Kyiv today with no sign of de-escalation in fighting in Ukraine's eastern provinces.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Will it be Emmanuel Macron or Marine Le Pen?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: France began voting in a presidential run-off election, in a race between incumbent president Emmanuel Macron and far-right politician Marine Le Pen.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Macron is slightly ahead in the opinion polls to win re-election for a second five-year term.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Yet his lead over Le Pen depends on one major uncertainty, voters who could decide to abstain and stay at home.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Indeed, we can say that we didn't have many choices, but we still have to vote.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: I think it was also a real choice between different candidates who presented completely different views of society.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Even if we are not happy or agree, I think there was a choice of clear and precise ideas that could be confronted with each other." All opinion polls in recent days showed a win for the 44-year-old pro-European candidate, but the margin over the 53-year-old nationalist rival is not at all comfortable for the current president.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Ahead of the US Secretary of State Antony Blinken's visit to Kyiv today, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky held a crowded press conference in a Kyiv metro station, where he was quick to criticise the UN Secretary-General for visiting Moscow before his own capital.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: He told reporters that any snap referendum organized by Russia in the occupied regions of Donetsk or Luhansk would put an end to peace negotiations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: In a follow-up video posted on Facebook, the Ukrainian president gave an account of the

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: latest Russian attack on Odessa.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Zelensky says that today Russia launched another missile attack on Odessa.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: As of now, eight people are dead, with 18 wounded.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: These are ordinary, peaceful people.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Among those was a three-month-old baby girl.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Zelenskyy asks how could she have been a threat to Russia, and says it seems that killing children was becoming interwoven in Russia's national psyche.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Russia later confirmed the attack on the city.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Kyiv for its part said two Russian generals had been killed on the Kursyn front.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: According to the US-based Institute for the Study of War, Russia appears to be deploying more troops in the east of the country, preparing in particular for a massive offensive in the Donbas provinces.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The standoff in Mariupol remains uncertain.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Ukraine claims that another attempt to evacuate civilians sheltering in the Azovstal steel plant has been halted.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: For the moment, the steelworks remain in Kiev's hands, but Russian forces continue its siege with relentless pressure.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Packing worldly belongings and keepsakes to flee the fighting in Mariupol.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: That's what this family with four children have done after spending two months in their basement.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: They walked 100 kilometers to catch a train at Saborizhia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The dad says, we walked for five days from village to village.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: At night, some old people were giving us shelter.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: village. At night some old people were giving us shelter." The strength of love pulls them through, but it's a tough time for the children on so many different levels.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: For these parents, their youngsters have shown inner resolve they'd not seen before.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The mother says, we had no idea that they were this strong.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: They are really, really strong.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: I'm very proud of them.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The father says, I cannot put words on how we feel.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: We're really proud of them.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The 10-year-old daughter says, well, it wasn't so scary.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: It shook a lot when they hit the nine-storey building near our basement.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: There was a lot of dust that fell from the ceiling.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: It was full of dust and it was in the air.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Leaving for Lviv, they look to the future.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: But the war in Ukraine is something that will stay with them.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The dad says we will never forget what happened, we cannot, but we need to keep our spirits and raise our children.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: More than 7.1 million people are now internally displaced in Ukraine since the conflict began, according to the latest figures from the International Organization for Migration.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Humanitarian needs continue to soar in the country, with more than 100,000 people still trapped in Meriupol.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Eight bodies have been recovered after a boat carrying 60 migrants capsized on Saturday off the Lebanese coast, raising the death toll to nine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Rescuers managed to save 45 people on the boat.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Lebanon was a country that took in refugees, but since the country's economic crisis since October 2019, hundreds have left on boats heading to Europe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Japanese coast guards confirmed suddenly that 10 people have died along its northern coast, following the sinking of a tourist boat.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Rescue helicopters had found nine of the 26 missing people after coastguards were alerted when strayed passengers sent an SOS call on Saturday. Rough sea conditions, strong winds and cold temperatures had indicated to authorities that survival was unlikely.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Several hundred people gathered in Brussels to protest against Julian Assange's extradition to the US.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: His wife and lawyer, Stella Morris, along with former leader of Britain's Labour Party, Jeremy Corbyn, took part in the event.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: With Morris saying, the soul of European values was at stake.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: saying the soul of European values was at stake.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Inside the ornate Church of the Holy Sepulchre in Jerusalem, Orthodox Christians celebrate their Holy Fire ceremony, in which hundreds light candles for Easter celebrations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: It's being held at a tense time for the city. Violence has fled massively between police and Palestinians, with Israeli authorities raiding the nearby Al-Aqsa Mosque in recent days.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: And in this holy land, tensions can easily escalate quickly.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: New restrictions have been brought in on the ceremony's attendees after a stampede at a Jewish holy site killed 45 last year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Local Christian leaders say, however, there's no need to alter an event that's been held for centuries.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Orthodox Easter celebrations were held in St. George's Cathedral in Istanbul on Saturday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Orthodox Christians mark Easter this week because they follow the old Julian calendar.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: For Ukrainians now in Athens, the celebrations are a little different.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: About 80% of Ukrainians are believed to be affiliated with some form of Orthodox Christianity, with 10% of the country professing to being part of the Ukrainian Greek Catholic Church.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: This woman says that it is a classic tradition to gather around the table for Easter in her family.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: But unfortunately this year the situation is such that she is celebrating it here in Greece and her parents back in Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Egyptian Copts gathered in Cairo on Saturday on the eve of the Coptic Christian religious festival of Easter.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Coptic Christians are the largest Christian denomination in Egypt, as well as the Middle East, Sudan and Libya.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Celebrations also took place in the Palestinian city of Ramallah.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: As the story goes, the light of manting from the Church of the Holy Sepulchre arrived in Ramallah from the city of Jerusalem.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The village museum in the Romanian capital Bucharest is one of the first open-air ethnographic museums in the world. Over 340 traditional houses are on display from different historical regions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: In the run-up to the Orthodox Easter, artisans display their skills in one of the most important traditions, egg painting. In Romania, painting and decorating eggs for Easter is a traditional art. There are specific symbols and colours used by the artisans which have different meanings such as life, nature or eternity. The decorations of the Easter eggs have a powerful meaning and they are manually painted by experienced artisans.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: But eggs are not just for decoration in Romania. They are also an important part of the traditional Easter menu, much of which is based on hard-boiled eggs. There is also a traditional cake named pasca, which is a sweet bread with cheese filling. Another famous Easter speciality is cozonac, a kind of Romanian panettone, and like the eggs it should be prepared three days before Easter.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: In the Easter basket we place the pasca cake, which is very important.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: We also place an egg, a piece of bacon, green onions, garlic, a small glass of salt and a penny to bring luck, and sausage and other foodstuffs we have in the house for them to be blessed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: When we return from church, both the children and the elders are happy for all these goodies in the basket. and when they come home, the children and the elderly are happy with the goodness of the Corsica.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: In Romania, the days in the run-up to Easter are known as Holy Week.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: It's a time when many people fast, and the days are considered an opportunity for the faithful to express their forgiveness and to reconcile with their fellow believers.
